E-Levy implementation: Salaries paid from companies to individual bank account no e-levy applies.  

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: ATM withdrawals do not attract e-levy so we are safe. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: If you use checks no e-levy will apply. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: If you're doing payment online from your debit card may be through Amazon (it is not registered with the GRA) so you will pay e-levy. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: You will always see a prompt when transacting. Once there is a figure you will know that the person is not on the GRA platform hence, you will be charged. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: The coverage is five and the exemptions are seven under the e-levy. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: When the person/meechant is registered on the GRA platform. Then you can use the payment option on the Momo platform for you to be exempted. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: When the person is transferring hundred cedis every day he is not poor and he is exempted from the e-levy. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: On the Momo platform there is a distinction between a transfer and payment. Don't use transfers to make payment to be on a safer side. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: If you transfer from your bank account to Momo you won't be charged. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: If your transfer exceeds Ghc100 from one account to the other person that is where the e-levy applies. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: We are using the identities behind the name and that's where the Ghana card comes in. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy: If you're making a transfer on the same network that comes under the purview of the e-levy act. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy: The first hundred cedis is tax-free in a day. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

E-Levy: There won't be any drastic change but extra information will appear on your phone to see the charges. 

Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako #TheKeyPoints

Breakdown of Govt’s e-levy

1. Covers electronic transactions on mobile money payments, bank transfers, merchant payments & inward remittances

2. A 1.75% rate shall be borne by the sender

3. Transactions up to 100 cedis per day are exempt 

4. Takes effect Feb 1, 2022

Folks,brace yourselves for more taxes.Government has imposed an Electronic Transactions Levy or “E-levy” on all electronic transactions.This covers Momo,Bank Transfers,Merchant payments and inward remittances.

More hardships for Ghanaians.
